posts.post_content: Card advantage is card advantage, even if it is lands. [Tranquil Thicket](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tranquil Thicket), [Quicksand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quicksand), [Seismic Assault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seismic Assault), and [Wasteland](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wasteland) can turn that card advantage into effects that change the gamestate, and if the opponent can't kill you, that card advantage will win you the game.
posts.html:
Card advantage is card advantage, even if it is lands. Tranquil Thicket, Quicksand, Seismic Assault, and Wasteland can turn that card advantage into effects that change the gamestate, and if the opponent can't kill you, that card advantage will win you the game.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Maraxas-of-Keld (12/13/2009 8:12:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Every time I hear people talk about this card I get sad.   
Back when Ravnica first came out I was still in my early Timmy stages, I didn't fully grasp the concept of card advantage and I thought Dredge was terrible. Yes I was a hardcore noob during Ravnica. I opened this card in a booster at my local card shop and a loud resounding "What the hell is this good for?" was heard from my mouth. Many advanced players came over to me and gasped. One very sneaky player came over very quickly and smiled. "I'll trade you a [Grozoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grozoth) for that."  
I made that trade so fast that my Timmy spirit was on fire. I thought I had taken that guy for a sucker.   
Now... I look back on that day, and simply shake my head, if only I had known.
posts.html:

One very sneaky player came over very quickly and smiled. "I'll trade you a Grozoth for that."
I made that trade so fast that my Timmy spirit was on fire. I thought I had taken that guy for a sucker.
Now... I look back on that day, and simply shake my head, if only I had known.

Posted By: supershawn (3/4/2011 8:01:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is part of one of the most interesting and effective card-draw engines! :) Together with cycle lands like [Tranquil Thicket](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tranquil Thicket), you can draw three cards for five mana as many times as you like, but you have to spend the first two mana at the same time and during the main phase.. Also, you can trigger powerful cards like [Lightning Rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Rift) or [Astral Slide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Astral Slide) over and over! :)
  
   
Edit: True, you have to skip one draw to get this card back into your hand, but you choose between skipping one of your draw steps and skipping one of the draws when cycling a land card.. Thank you for your correction! :)
posts.html:
This card is part of one of the most interesting and effective card-draw engines! :) Together with cycle lands like Tranquil Thicket, you can draw three cards for five mana as many times as you like, but you have to spend the first two mana at the same time and during the main phase.. Also, you can trigger powerful cards like Lightning Rift or Astral Slide over and over! :)

Edit: True, you have to skip one draw to get this card back into your hand, but you choose between skipping one of your draw steps and skipping one of the draws when cycling a land card.. Thank you for your correction! :)

posts.post_content: This is basically a repeatable [Mulch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mulch), in a way, and Mulch is a fantastic card in any graveyard deck. It puts Incarnations into graveyards, puts beefy creatures in the graveyard to be  [Breath of Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Breath of Life)d later, it puts flashback cards where you can get them for cheaper, etc. Oh, and it gives you all the lands you'll ever need. Great cards, both Mulch and Life From the Loam.
posts.html:

Posted By: Dr.Pingas (1/29/2012 7:58:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I hate when a useful card for a simple deck type has to go crazy in price because of some abusable/lame johnny deck. I understand the usage, but it makes running a regular casual dredge deck nigh impossible. It's literally cheaper to build a vintage ready ichorid deck than it is to get a playset of this and/or grave-trolls to make a regular dredge deck work well.   
  
That said, I have a brutal ichorid deck that costed less than two of these cards or so... and it'll always be better than even the dredge deck that wants these. Quite sad..
posts.html:
